intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium murorum subsp. prasinochroum, commonly known as the green-veined hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and basal rosettes of leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped with a distinctive greenish-white coloration on the underside. It thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides.
